sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The agrement of the holye fathers, and doctors of the churche, vpon the cheifest articles of Christian religion as appeareth on the nexte syde folowinge, very necessary for all curates. Gathered together by Iohn Aungell preist, one of the Quenes maiesties chapleyns. Angel, John, fl. 1555.
[6], cviii, [2] leaves
By William Harford, for William Seres. Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum, [Imprinted at Lo[n]don in Aldersgate strete : [1555?]]
Imprint from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Formerly also STC 958. Identified as STC 958 on UMI microfilm reel 307. Reproductions of the originals in Bodleian Library and the British Library. Appears at reel 165 £ (Bodleian Library copy) and at reel 307 #1 (British Library copy, identified as STC 958). At foot of title page: Cum priuilegis imprimendum solum.
=======
The agrement of the holye fathers, and doctors of the churche, vpon the cheifest articles of Christian religion as appeareth on the nexte syde folowinge, very necessary for all curates. Gathered together by Iohn Aungell preist, one of the Quenes maiesties chapleyns. Angel, John, fl. 1555.
[6], cviii, [2] leaves
By William Harford, for William Seres. Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum, [Imprinted at Lo[n]don in Aldersgate strete : [1555?]]
Imprint from colophon; publication date conjectured by STC. Formerly also STC 958. Identified as STC 958 on UMI microfilm reel 307. Reproductions of the originals in Bodleian Library and the British Library. Appears at reel 165 £ (Bodleian Library copy) and at reel 307 #1 (British Library copy, identified as STC 958). At foot of title page: Cum priuilegis imprimendum solum.
William Seres.
William Harford
